thread.title: Huckabee denies campaign on last legs
thread.title_full: Huckabee denies campaign on last legs

author: Cheryl Chumley
title: Huckabee denies campaign on last legs
text:
Huckabee denies campaign on last legs Tells Fox News audience: 'That's nonsense' Published: 1 hour ago Cheryl Chumley About | Email | Archive Cheryl K. Chumley is a staff writer for WND and author of "Police State USA: How Orwell's Nightmare is Becoming our Reality." Formerly with the Washington Times, she is a journalism fellow with The Phillips Foundation in Washington, D.C., where she spent a year researching and writing about private property rights. Text bigger Mike Huckabee 
Former Arkansas governor Mike Huckabee, whose numbers in the polls for president have hovered around the middle of the Republican pack, said in answer to a direct question on “Fox & Friends” on Monday about his campaign’s chances that he’s still pretty positive – that his race is far from ended. 
First, the question: What do you say to those who say your campaign is “on life support?” 
Then, Huckabee’s response: That’s not true. 
“That’s nonsense,” he said. “People who say that sit in their little buildings in Washington … if they want to look at a [real] campaign, come to Iowa.” 
Get the hottest, most important news stories on the Internet – delivered FREE to your inbox as soon as they break! Take just 30 seconds and sign up for WND’s Email News Alerts! 
Huckabee said crowds swarmed in Iowa to the point where his campaign “couldn’t fit [them] in the room.” 
He then went on to say: “It incenses me when people who have no idea what a campaign is about say, ‘Well, Huckabee’s campaign is on life support.” 
He then pointed to pundits who predicted a Rudy Giuliani win eight years ago and a Rick Perry win four years ago as a means of showing how wrong the supposed political experts can be. 
At the same time, the Hill reported Huckabee’s recent donor draw at $1.24 million for the last reporting period, one of the lowest for the Republican candidates. And in recent polls, Real Clear Politics puts him at seventh place with 3 percentage points. 
In the Hill , GOP strategist Ford O’Connell, one of former presidential contender John McCain’s leading political operatives, said: “Donors want to back the winner and it’s becoming completely clear who the winners are likely to be.” 
Who do you love? Get your favorite presidential bumper sticker here! Check out WND Superstore’s mind-blowing and hilarious selection 
But Huckabee spokeswoman Alice Stewart shot back and said such strategists are dead wrong. 
“We’ve done this before, can do it again and will have the resources we need to be successful in Iowa, the early southern states and beyond,” she said, referencing Huckabee’s 2008 president run and his come-from-behind win at the Iowa caucus, to the Hill. Text smaller
